Title: AAA Partners With Legal Blockchain Pioneer Integra
Description:
Just when you thought that blockchain had vanished from legal tech‚Ä¶.here comes the American Arbitration Association and a new deal with Integra Ledger to provide a ‚Äòsecure, blockchain-powered document registration and authentication service'.

And of course, if you are a long-time reader of AL, then you know of Integra already, a company that has pioneered the area of blockchain use in the legal field.

But, you may then ask: ‚ÄòWhy blockchain?' The AAA explained that using the now well-known verifiable ‚Äòtruth' aspect of blockchain means those engaged in an arbitration can ‚Äòuphold the integrity of source documents in an era of increasing AI-driven manipulation and forgery'.

I.e. AI deep fakes are so good now that those involved in a dispute may need to get some additional bona fides for any documents they are using. Blockchain, which although is perhaps not as lauded as it once was beyond the crypto world, can help with this. Hence the deal.

The move follows a series of tech-focused steps that the AAA has taken recently, which includes developing an ‚ÄòAI arbitrator' for construction disputes.

Bridget McCormack, president and CEO of the AAA, commented: ‚ÄòAs AI becomes more advanced, it's essential to preserve trust in the documents that support our legal and commercial systems. Our partnership with Integra Ledger gives parties a way to confirm the authenticity and integrity of their documents, today and in the future. By expanding access to this technology, we're democratizing the tools needed to preserve the integrity of critical information in the age of AI.'

David Fisher, CEO of Integra Ledger, added: ‚ÄòPartnering with the AAA, an organization with nearly a century of leadership in dispute resolution, allows us to bring our blockchain-based document trust technology to the global community. Working with the AAA, we're pleased to make this service available to all who can benefit from it, empowering individuals and organizations with the ability secure trust in their documents for the long term.'

In terms of how it works:

To learn more about the service, or to access the free document authentication platform (limits apply), visit the Integra site here.

‚Äì

Is this a big deal? Well, the central point about trust is one that blockchain fans have been making now for about a decade. Even so, most blockchain use cases have tended to revolve around crypto and businesses have continued to use their DMSs or other storage systems as usual.

But‚Ä¶perhaps with the rise of deep fakes that may change? The move to use blockchain may become more attractive as the future of document verification becomes more complex. We shall see. AL has always felt that blockchain was useful ‚Äì but it needed to be applied where trust had really evaporated and/or is not present in the system, in order to really maximise the move from regular data stores to this approach. Let's see if it catches on. Maybe this time it's different for legal‚Ä¶?

‚Äî

Legal Innovators Conferences in London and New York ‚Äì November '25

If you'd like to stay ahead of the legal AI curve then come along to Legal Innovators New York, Nov 19 + 20 and also, Legal Innovators UK ‚Äì Nov 4 + 5 + 6, where the brightest minds will be sharing their insights on where we are now and where we are heading. 

Legal Innovators UK arrives first, with: Law Firm Day on Nov 4th, then Inhouse Day, on the 5th, and then our new Litigation Day on the 6th. 

Both events, as always, are organised by the Cosmonauts team! 

Please get in contact with them if you'd like to take part.

Title: How to Build an NFT Marketplace Platform Like OpenSea
Description:
Introduction 

The digital world is changing fast, and NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens) are at the heart of this change. Business owners, entrepreneurs, and creators are searching for ways to build platforms like OpenSea to connect with collectors and generate new revenue. The demand for NFT Marketplace Development Services is growing because such platforms allow users to trade unique digital assets with security, transparency, and speed.

Building your own NFT marketplace may seem complex, but with the right strategy, tools, and guidance, you can create a successful business in this booming industry. Let's walk through how you can design and launch an NFT marketplace like OpenSea.

Key Features of OpenSea-Style NFT Marketplaces

An NFT marketplace must be easy to use, secure, and scalable. If your platform lacks these elements, users will move elsewhere. Here are some must-have features:

User-Friendly Dashboard: Buyers and sellers should navigate with ease.

Advanced Search and Filters: Helps collectors find specific NFTs quickly.

NFT Minting Options: Artists and creators should be able to create and list NFTs easily.

Wallet Integration: Essential for secure payments and seamless transactions.

Auction and Bidding Systems: Engage users and boost sales.

Decentralized Storage: Keeps NFTs secure and tamper-proof.

Royalty Management: Supports creators with ongoing revenue.

These features are the backbone of platforms like OpenSea, ensuring trust and growth in the NFT space.

Step-by-Step Process to Build an NFT Marketplace Like OpenSea

Creating an NFT marketplace requires a structured approach. Let's explore the essential steps.

Step 1: Designing an Intuitive UI/UX for Your NFT Marketplace

A clean and intuitive design builds trust. Users should easily browse categories, search collections, and manage their profiles. Simple interfaces mean less confusion and more engagement.

Step 2: Choose the Blockchain Network 

The choice of blockchain defines your platform's speed, cost, and scalability. Ethereum is widely used, but many businesses also prefer Solana, Polygon, or Binance Smart Chain. The right blockchain depends on your business goals and user base.

Step 3: Developing Smart Contracts for Secure NFT Transactions

Smart contracts automate transactions and ensure fairness. They protect users against fraud and give creators confidence that royalties will be paid on every resale.

Step 4: NFT Minting Module

Creators should be able to mint NFTs with minimal steps. An easy minting process attracts more artists and keeps your platform active with new collections.

Step 5: Implementing Wallet Integration and Payment Systems

Your NFT marketplace must support popular crypto wallets like MetaMask, Trust Wallet, and Coinbase Wallet. Adding payment gateways also helps users who are new to crypto.

Step 6: Building Backend Infrastructure with Decentralized Storage

NFTs are unique digital assets. Storing them securely with decentralized storage like IPFS ensures safety and transparency. This adds credibility to your marketplace.

Step 7: Testing, Deployment, and Ongoing Platform Management 

Before launch, test every feature carefully. Check the minting process, wallet connections, and transaction flows. After deployment, continuous monitoring is needed for updates, bug fixes, and smooth performance.

Monetization Strategies and Future of NFT Marketplaces

A successful NFT marketplace must generate sustainable revenue. Popular monetization strategies include:

The future of NFT marketplaces looks promising, especially with white label NFT marketplace development solutions that allow businesses to launch platforms faster. With growing adoption across industries like music, gaming, fashion, and real estate, opportunities are endless.

Why Choose a Professional Development Company

Building an NFT marketplace is not just about coding. It requires expertise in blockchain, design, and scalability. Working with an NFT Marketplace Development Company ensures your platform is secure, user-friendly, and ready to grow. Professionals handle smart contracts, wallet integrations, and testing, saving you time and costly mistakes. For business leaders, this means faster time-to-market and peace of mind.

Conclusion

NFT marketplaces are shaping the future of digital trade, and creating one like OpenSea requires planning, the right technology, and expert support. Partnering with the right team makes the journey smoother. Justtry Technologies is a leading Blockchain Development Company that provides end-to-end NFT marketplace development and white label NFT marketplace solutions. With their expertise, you can build a scalable, secure, and profitable NFT business that connects with today's digital-first audience.

Introduction

The digital economy has entered a new era with NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens). Businesses, artists, gamers, and collectors now see NFTs not only as assets but as opportunities to create sustainable revenue. Yet many entrepreneurs face a common challenge: they want to enter the NFT world but lack clarity on how to develop a profitable strategy.

In the evolving landscape of blockchain technology, Stablecoin Payments have emerged as a groundbreaking solution bridging the gap between traditional finance and decentralized ecosystems. Unlike volatile cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin or Ethereum, stablecoins are pegged to assets like the U.S. dollar, euro, or commodities. This stability makes them ideal for real-world transactions, where predictability and minimal fluctuation are critical. As global adoption of digital assets accelerates, stablecoins are no longer confined to crypto exchanges‚Äîthey are becoming the backbone of payment infrastructures.

Title: Maple Gold Announces Upsize of Brokered LIFE Offering to $13 Million
Description:
Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - September 25, 2025) - Maple Gold Mines Ltd. MGM ("Maple Gold" or the "Company") is pleased to announce that it has entered into an agreement to upsize its previously announced "best efforts" private placement offering (the "Offering") with Beacon Securities Limited ("Beacon"), on behalf of a syndicate of agents including Agentis Capital Markets Limited Partnership, Cormark Securities Inc., and Paradigm Capital Inc. (together with Beacon, the "Agents"). Under the amended terms of the Offering, the Company will issue up to 4,167,000 non-flow-through common shares of the Company (the "NFT Shares") at a price of $1.20 per NFT Share (the "NFT Issue Price") and up to 4,762,000 flow-through common shares of the Company (the "FT Shares", and together with the NFT Shares, the "Offered Securities") at a price of $1.68 per FT Share (the "FT Issue Price") for total gross proceeds to the Company of up to $13,000,560 (the "Offering").

Each FT Share shall qualify as a "flow-through share" for the purposes of the Income Tax Act (Canada) (the "Tax Act").

The Offered Securities will be offered pursuant to Part 5A (the "Listed Issuer Financing Exemption") of National Instrument 45-106 - Prospectus Exemptions ("NI 45-106") to purchasers resident in Canada, however, the Offering in Qu√©bec will not commence until such time as the French Form 45-106F19 has been filed and posted on SEDAR+, and in other qualifying jurisdictions outside of Canada, including the United States, that are mutually agreed to by the Company and Beacon pursuant to relevant prospectus or registration exemptions in accordance with applicable laws. The Offered Securities issued under the Listed Issuer Financing Exemption to Canadian subscribers will not be subject to a hold period in Canada.

The Company will use an amount equal to the gross proceeds from the sale of the FT Shares to incur eligible "Canadian exploration expenses" (as defined in the Tax Act): (i) that will qualify as "flow-through mining expenditures" (as defined in the Tax Act) and, (ii) in respect of Qu√©bec resident subscribers who are eligible individuals under the Taxation Act (Qu√©bec) (the "Qu√©bec Tax Act"), that will also qualify for inclusion in the "exploration base relating to certain Qu√©bec exploration expenses" within the meaning of section 726.4.10 of the Qu√©bec Tax Act and for inclusion in the "exploration base relating to certain Qu√©bec surface mining expenses" within the meaning of section 726.4.17.2 of the Qu√©bec Tax Act (collectively, the "Qualifying Expenditures") related to the Company's mineral properties located in Qu√©bec, Canada on or before December 31, 2026. All Qualifying Expenditures will be renounced in favour of the subscribers effective December 31, 2025. The Company intends to use the net proceeds from the sale of NFT Shares for general and administrative expenses and unallocated working capital purposes over a period of 12 months following closing of the Offering.

There is an offering document related to this Offering that can be accessed under the Company's profile at www.sedarplus.ca and on the Company's website at www.maplegoldmines.com. Prospective investors should read this offering document before making an investment decision.

The Offering is expected to close on or about October 23, 2025 (the "Closing Date") and is subject to the Company receiving all necessary regulatory approvals, including the approval of the TSX Venture Exchange.

Offers for sale of the Offered Securities in the United States may only be made to a limited number of "accredited investors" (as defined in Rule 501(a) of Regulation D under the United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "1933 Act")) and to "qualified institutional buyers" (as defined in Rule 144A), that are also accredited investors, in each case, by way of a private placement pursuant to the exemption from the registration requirements of the 1933 Act provided by Rule 506(b) of Regulation D under the 1933 Act and/or Section 4(a)(2) of the 1933 Act, and similar exemptions under applicable state securities laws. The Offered Securities to be offered pursuant to the Offering have not been, and will not be, registered under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "U.S. Securities Act") or any U.S. state securities laws, and may not be offered or sold in the United States or to, or for the account or benefit of, United States persons absent registration or any applicable exemption from the registration requirements of the U.S. Securities Act and applicable U.S. state securities laws. This press release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy nor shall there be any sale of the securities in any jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale would be unlawful.

About Maple Gold

Maple Gold Mines Ltd. is a Canadian advanced exploration company focused on advancing its 100%-owned, district-scale Douay/Joutel Gold Project located in Qu√©bec's prolific Abitibi Greenstone Gold Belt. Douay/Joutel benefits from exceptional infrastructure access and boasts ~481 km2 of highly prospective ground including an established gold mineral resource at Douay with significant expansion potential as well as the past-producing Telbel and Eagle West mines at Joutel. In addition, the Company holds an exclusive option to acquire 100% of the Eagle Mine Property, a key part of the historical Joutel Mining Complex.

Maple Gold's property package also hosts a significant number of regional exploration targets along a 55-km strike length of the Casa Berardi Deformation Zone that have yet to be tested through drilling, making the property ripe for new gold and VMS discoveries. The Company is currently focused on carrying out exploration and drill programs to grow mineral resources and make new discoveries to establish an exciting new gold district in the heart of the Abitibi. For more information, please visit www.maplegoldmines.com.

ON BEHALF OF MAPLE GOLD MINES LTD.

"Kiran Patankar"

Title: Seedify SFUND Bridge Hacked, $1.2M Stolen
Description:
On September 23, Seedify fell victim to a major security exploit where a developer's private key was hijacked. This key was used to manipulate the system's OFT bridge contract‚Äîa component previously cleared by numerous security audits. The breach enabled the attackers to mint vast quantities of SFUND tokens on the Avalanche chain, sidestepping the usual requirement of equivalent deposits, resulting in significant discrepancies in token balances.

Today at approximately 12:05 UTC, a DPRK state-affiliated group known for many hacks in Web3 gained access to one of our developer's private keys. Using these, they were able to mint a large amount of SFUND tokens through a bridge contract that had previously passed audit.The‚Ä¶

Following the minting, the attackers executed rapid transactions across multiple blockchains including Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Base, thus draining liquidity pools. A large portion of the illicitly obtained tokens was subsequently transferred to the BNB Chain and sold off, triggering an almost 60% plummet in the token's market price. More than $1.2 million worth of value was siphoned from the system during this coordinated attack.

Seedify responded promptly to the breach by shutting down the compromised bridge and suspending token transactions on the impacted platforms to prevent further damage. Trading was also temporarily halted on centralized exchanges to manage market volatility effectively. Efforts to mitigate losses included freezing about $200,000 of the stolen funds.

The attack was attributed to a notorious North Korean hacker group, well-known within the web3 community for its previous cyber offenses. This attribution was supported by onchain analysis from security professionals such as ZachXBT and ZeroShadow, who documented the precision and rapid progression of the token movements across four different blockchains.

Meta Alchemist, the founder of Seedify, announced a remediation and improvement strategy dubbed the ‚ÄúPhoenix Raise‚Äù. This initiative is designed to address the breach's repercussions through user compensations, token buybacks, and a major overhaul of security protocols. It encompasses comprehensive contract re-audits and a new bounty program aimed at exposing security vulnerabilities.

The incident has highlighted ongoing vulnerabilities in cross-chain bridge operations and centralization risks, prompting a wider discussion on enhancing security measures. Proposals include adopting multi-signature processes and introducing execution delays for critical functions to strengthen the infrastructure against future attacks.

The breach at Seedify acts as a stark reminder of the complexities and risks associated with web3 technologies, particularly regarding the handling of private keys and security protocols. The platform's response and the execution of the ‚ÄúPhoenix Raise‚Äù initiative could potentially set a new standard in the industry for crisis management and recovery from cyber-attacks in the cryptocurrency domain.

Title: Meteora TGE Proposal: 3% Allocation to JUP Stakers via LP NFTs
Description:
Written by Linh B√πi

Edited by Oihyun Kim

Meteora is stirring the Solana community with a controversial proposal: to allocate 3% of the TGE fund to JUP stakers, not in regular tokens but in Liquidity Position NFTs.

This novel approach promises to bootstrap deep liquidity for MET from day one, yet it raises questions about fairness and concentration risk. Will this be a savvy move to bridge the two communities, or will it ignite a prolonged debate?

As BeInCrypto reported, Meteora is preparing for a TGE in October. The platform floated one of the community's most notable proposals ahead of MET's TGE. 

Under the plan, the project intends to allocate 3% of the TGE fund to Jupiter's JUP stakers as Liquidity Position NFTs. Specifically, Meteora would use the 3% to seed MET liquidity in a Single-Sided DAMM V2 pool, then allocate positions to Jupiter stakers based on time-weighted staking, amount, and voting activity.

The objective is to create MET/USDC liquidity at listing without immediately adding more MET to the circulating supply. The proposal also emphasizes that ‚Äúno additional tokens circulating will be added due to this proposal.‚Äù This is a ‚Äúliquidity-first‚Äù approach rather than a direct token payout.

Meteora's Co-Lead, Soju, published a public calculation to visualize scale. According to Soju, roughly 600 million JUP are currently staked. A 3% allocation would equal 30 million MET tokens. That works out to about 0.05 MET per staked JUP.

‚ÄúI think its reasonable,‚Äù Soju shared.

A user on X ran some napkin math and produced a similar figure of ~0.05035 MET/JUP depending on FDV assumptions. The per-JUP reward is small but aggregated at scale, so it can serve as a meaningful incentive to convert users into MET liquidity providers.

Meteora's proposal has clear upsides compared to other projects that reward users via airdrops. It explicitly recognizes Jupiter's role in the Solana ecosystem, helps bootstrap MET/USDC liquidity at TGE, and reduces the immediate sell pressure because the initial reward is a liquidity position rather than freely tradable tokens. With careful engineering (time-weighted distribution, vesting attached to NFTs, withdrawal restrictions), this could be an effective bridge between the two communities.

However, significant risks remain. The community has raised fairness concerns: why should JUP stakers receive a large share? Could an ‚ÄúLP Army‚Äù or large wallets capture a disproportionate share of the rewards? What will the circulating supply be at TGE immediately? Earlier allocation drafts mentioned up to 25% reserved for liquidity/TGE reserve, so the total initial circulating supply remains a material transparency question.

‚ÄúDifficult to debate on ‚Äòfairness' when JUP gave up 5% for Meteora (via mercurial stakeholders). LP army deserves more -> LP Army will capture a significant chunk of all future emissions (ongoing LM rewards), and still possess 20% (8% + 5% + 2% + 3% + 2%) of total supply at TGE,‚Äù Soju noted.

From past airdrop events, Meteora's team must be transparent about tokenomics, clearly disclose the LP NFT redeem/vest mechanics, set per-address caps, and consider additional incentives for MET holders. If executed poorly, concentrated distribution and subsequent sell pressure could erode TGE's value.

Title: What Is ICO Marketing? Strategies to Ensure a Successful ICO Launch
Description:
Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) have become one of the most dynamic fundraising mechanisms in the blockchain and cryptocurrency ecosystem. By issuing tokens to investors, startups and enterprises can secure capital to develop projects and scale operations. However, with thousands of ICOs launched over the past decade, competition for investor attention has become fierce. This is where ICO marketing plays a crucial role. It goes beyond basic promotion, focusing on building trust, creating awareness, and establishing a credible project identity. A strong ICO marketing strategy helps projects reach their target audience, communicate their vision, and ensure long-term sustainability in a highly competitive market.

Launching a successful ICO requires more than just an innovative idea it demands a carefully structured foundation that instills confidence among investors. Core marketing components act as the backbone of any ICO strategy, ensuring that every touchpoint reflects professionalism, credibility, and transparency. From detailed whitepapers and roadmaps to polished branding and a credible team presence, these elements build the narrative around the project. Investors need clarity on not just what the project does, but also how it plans to achieve its vision. Without these essentials, even the most promising ideas risk fading into obscurity.

Every successful ICO begins with a deep understanding of its target audience and the market it operates in. Without knowing who the project is meant for, even the most innovative solution can miss its mark. An experienced ICO Marketing Agency can provide in-depth investor research, helping identify whether the token offering appeals more to institutional investors, retail traders, or crypto enthusiasts. Market analysis further uncovers trends, opportunities, and gaps within the industry. Competitor benchmarking and regulatory awareness refine positioning, ensuring that messaging resonates with investors while staying compliant in a complex and evolving blockchain landscape.

A thriving community is one of the most powerful assets an ICO can have. In the decentralized world of blockchain, community members aren't just spectators they are advocates, investors, and contributors who help spread awareness and drive growth. Active engagement fosters loyalty, while open communication channels create trust between project teams and supporters. Hosting discussions, answering questions, and providing updates ensures that investors feel valued and informed. Strong communities are also resilient, helping projects withstand challenges and build long-term momentum. Ultimately, an engaged community turns an ICO from just another token sale into a movement that investors want to back.

Content is the bridge that connects complex blockchain ideas to investors in a clear and compelling way. A well-designed content strategy helps projects simplify technical details, showcase their expertise, and establish authority within the crypto ecosystem. Educational resources such as whitepapers, blog posts, and case studies offer transparency, while visually engaging formats like videos and infographics make information accessible to a broader audience. Beyond attracting investors, consistent content builds long-term trust and enhances search visibility. In a market flooded with hype, authentic and informative content ensures that projects stand out for the right reasons.

In today's digital ecosystem, credibility is often amplified by voices of influence. Strategic partnerships with influencers, industry leaders, and media outlets can significantly boost an ICO's visibility and reputation. Influencers serve as trusted intermediaries, helping projects reach audiences that already value their opinion. Media partnerships and interviews further validate the project's credibility, placing it on reputable platforms. By leveraging these collaborations, ICOs can tap into established communities, generate buzz, and foster trust at scale. When executed effectively, social and influencer partnerships create powerful endorsements that can make the difference between a successful and overlooked ICO.

While organic growth and community building form the backbone of long-term success, paid marketing accelerates reach and ensures visibility in competitive markets. Paid advertising channels allow projects to precisely target investors who are actively seeking blockchain opportunities. From crypto-friendly networks to search engine marketing, paid campaigns put the project directly in front of potential backers. Banner ads, display marketing, and retargeting campaigns ensure consistent visibility, driving traffic and conversions. When integrated with organic efforts, paid advertising provides a balanced approach, ensuring both immediate traction and sustainable growth for an ICO launch.

The real measure of ICO success isn't just in the funds raised but in the trust sustained afterward. Investors want assurance that the project will continue delivering value long after the token sale ends. This is why transparency, consistent communication, and post-ICO support are essential. Verified audits, performance monitoring, and milestone reporting reinforce credibility. Regular updates and responsive support foster loyalty and community strength. Additionally, analyzing campaign performance helps improve future strategies. By focusing on long-term growth and investor trust, projects transform their ICO from a one-time event into a lasting ecosystem.

Public relations (PR) and media exposure play a crucial role in building awareness and credibility for ICO projects. Unlike paid ads, PR is often perceived as more authentic because it comes from third-party publications or journalists. Strong media coverage can amplify a project's reach, attract attention from investors, and position the team as innovators in the blockchain space. By sharing updates, press releases, and thought leadership pieces, projects can gain authority in both crypto-specific and mainstream financial publications. PR acts as a bridge between technical innovation and public perception, making it a vital component of ICO marketing.

A successful ICO launch requires far more than innovative technology or token economics it depends on the strength of the marketing strategy. From building strong communities and crafting compelling content to leveraging influencers and ensuring transparency, each element plays a vital role. Projects that partner with the right experts, such as a reputable ICO Marketing Agency, gain the advantage of experience and strategic insight. By focusing on trust, engagement, and credibility, ICOs can not only achieve a successful launch but also build a sustainable future in the competitive blockchain ecosystem.

Decentralized applications (dApps) have transformed digital ecosystems by providing transparency, security, and direct user control. However, scaling these applications on traditional blockchain networks presents significant challenges. High transaction costs, slow confirmation times, and limited throughput hinder the ability to serve large user bases effectively. Layer 2 blockchain solutions are designed to overcome these limitations by offloading operations from the main chain while maintaining security through cryptographic proofs. Leveraging these solutions allows developers to build high-performance, cost-effective, and scalable dApps capable of handling increasing user demands without compromising decentralization or application reliability.

This article explores the role of legitimate crypto recovery companies, with a focus on Puran Crypto Recovery (PCR), a trusted leader in restoring financial security in 2025.

The stablecoin ecosystem has entered a new era where blockchain innovation meets tangible assets. Beyond fiat-backed tokens, a growing niche is emerging: commodity-backed stablecoins. These tokens are pegged to physical reserves such as gold, silver, oil, or a basket of metals, offering a hedge against inflation and bringing real-world assets on-chain. In this article, we explore the 10 commodity-backed stablecoin projects reshaping digital asset stability and why they matter in the broader conversation about Asset-Backed Stablecoins.

You couldn't walk over a creaky floorboard or see a line on a wall from one of her markers that didn't flood your mind with memories so vivid and strong it felt like a stroke. God, did we miss her.

Title: ICO fingers two rogue energy firms for ‚Äòrobo call' blitz
Description:
September 25, 2025 2:00 pm


UK consumers are being warned to be on their guard over a new spate of so-called ‚Äúrobo calls‚Äù after two energy companies have been fined a total of ¬£550,000 for unlawful automated marketing.‚ÄØ
Home Improvement Marketing (HIM), based in Pembrokeshire, has been whacked with a ¬£300,000 penalty for automated calls and issued with an enforcement notice ordering it to stop its unlawful practices.
From May 31 2023 to August 31 2023, it was found that HIM used an overseas call centre that made 2.4 million automated calls on behalf of the company, resulting in 274 complaints to the ICO and the TPS.
Meanwhile, Green Spark Energy (GSE), based in Durham, has been hit with a ¬£250,000 fine for making 9.5 million automated marketing calls. GSE has also been issued with an enforcement notice.
The 497 complainants about the GSE calls to the ICO and TPS included cancer patients and elderly people.
Both firms used an avatar software, which gave the call recipients the impression they were talking to ‚ÄúJo, Helen or Ian‚Äù from the UK ‚Äì but were in fact scripted lines recorded by voice actors and played by call agents abroad.‚ÄØ This is a contravention of the Privacy & Electronic Communication Regulations (PECR).
The companies previously shared a common director, Mathew Terry, who is currently the director of HIM and, until March 2024, was a director of GSE.
ICO head of investigations Andy Curry said the robo call technology ‚Äì which is widely used in the US ‚Äì is making it harder for the public to spot automated calls and report them to the regulator.
He added: ‚ÄúWe've heard disturbing reports of how unscrupulous companies are using robo technology to fool elderly and vulnerable people. We understand how distressing these calls can be and will work on the public's behalf to catch those responsible.
‚ÄúWe urge the public to take note of our tips to spot these robo calls so they can tell us when they've received one. This will help us investigate and take enforcement action.‚Äù

Title: ING, UniCredit join banks developing euro stablecoin under MiCA
Description:
A group of major European banks has joined forces to launch a euro-pegged stablecoin in compliance with Europe's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) framework.

Dutch lender ING and Italy's UniCredit are among nine banks participating in the development of a euro-denominated stablecoin, according to a joint statement published by ING on Thursday.

Built in compliance with Europe's MiCA regulation, the stablecoin is expected to be issued in the second half of 2026, with a mission of becoming a trusted European payment standard in the digital ecosystem.

The announcement noted that the initiative aligns with Europe's plans to provide a local alternative to the US-dominated stablecoin market and to contribute to the EU's strategic autonomy in payments.

Banks from eight EU member states initially involved

Alongside ING and UniCredit, the European stablecoin initiative also includes Spain's CaixaBank, Denmark's Danske Bank, Austria's Raiffeisen Bank International, Belgium's KBC, Sweden's SEB, Germany's DekaBank and another Italian lender, Banca Sella.

The founding members have also established a new company headquartered in the Netherlands, ING's home country, to oversee the development and management of the stablecoin.

The banking consortium said in the joint announcement that it remains open to other banks joining the stablecoin project.

24/7 access to cross-border payments

According to the statement by ING, the projected euro stablecoin is expected to provide ‚Äúnear-instant, low-cost payments and settlements,‚Äù enabling 24/7 access to cross-border payments.

The stablecoin is also set to offer programmable payments and improvements to supply chain management and digital asset settlements, which can vary from securities to cryptocurrencies.

‚ÄúDigital payments are key for new euro-denominated payments and financial market infrastructure,‚Äù said Floris Lugt, ING's digital asset lead and joint public representative for the project.

‚ÄúWe believe this development requires an industry-wide approach, and it's imperative that banks adopt the same standards,‚Äù he added.

Digital euro delayed to 2029

The announcement of a joint stablecoin project by leading European banks came shortly after European Central Bank Executive Board member Piero Cipollone estimated that the EU's digital euro could become a reality in 2029.

Cipollone, who also serves as deputy governor of the Bank of Italy, noted that the European Parliament is widely expected to outline a general framework for the EU's proposed central bank digital currency (CBDC) by May 2026.

Given the prolonged development of Europe's potential CBDC ‚Äî which has been under consideration since 2020 ‚Äî some online commentators described the new stablecoin launch as a ‚Äúdigital euro's obituary notice.‚Äù

Others have speculated that the upcoming stablecoin could serve as a ‚Äúbackdoor CBDC,‚Äù although, by definition, a CBDC is issued directly by a central bank.

The preference for stablecoins over CBDCs is not unprecedented. In early 2025, the Trump administration made a historic decision to ban CBDC development in the US, while simultaneously committing to promoting US dollar-backed stablecoins as a key component of its financial strategy.

Title: PublicSquare to Launch Crypto Treasury as a Service to Its Robust Merchant Ecosystem
Description:
PublicSquare to Launch Crypto Treasury as a Service to Its Robust Merchant Ecosystem

WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--PSQ Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: PSQH) (‚ÄúPublicSquare‚Äù or the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) proudly announced today a groundbreaking partnership with IDX Advisors to launch cryptocurrency Treasury as a Service (‚ÄúTaaS‚Äù) for businesses across the PublicSquare ecosystem. By combining PublicSquare's significant distribution power with IDX's industry-leading crypto technology, this collaboration empowers merchants to seamlessly integrate cryptocurrencies and stablecoins into their operations, while unlocking custody, trading, and yield-generating digital assets. In short, our merchants gain the ability to act as their own banks while capitalizing on the rapid growth of crypto finance.


‚ÄúThe economy as we know it is shifting at lightning speed, and with this partnership, PublicSquare and IDX are positioned at the forefront of tomorrow's financial revolution,‚Äù said Michael Seifert, Chairman and CEO of PublicSquare. ‚ÄúOur mission is to lead in crypto, and the winning strategy is clear: own the intersection of technology and distribution. We're not content to simply hold digital assets; we intend to monetize every transaction, every service, and every opportunity this transformation creates.‚Äù




IDX will provide outsourced Chief Investment Officer services (OCIO) for PublicSquare. This will be led by Ben McMillan, Co-Founder and CIO of IDX, a well-recognized thought leader in the financial and cryptocurrency community. Mr. McMillan will present a high-level overview of the IDX digital treasury service as part of the company's previously announced Analyst and Investor Day, scheduled for today, September 25, 2025.




‚ÄúIDX is excited to be working alongside PublicSquare to bring cutting-edge cryptocurrency solutions to businesses in the PublicSquare network,‚Äù commented McMillan. ‚ÄúSimplified access to digital asset solutions is the next stage of broader adoption of cryptocurrency within the business community, and this partnership will be an important step forward. PublicSquare is at the forefront of the new economic liberty paradigm, and IDX is ready to provide even further benefit.‚Äù




What is Treasury as a Service



Cryptocurrency Treasury as a Service is an outsourced solution for managing digital assets that protects businesses from financial deplatforming. It provides secure custody, seamless crypto-to-fiat conversion, automated compliance, and yield on idle assets, all without reliance on vulnerable, centralized intermediaries. By decentralizing custody, payments, and liquidity, TaaS gives companies a cancel-proof financial backbone. Our TaaS solution operates as a turnkey back office, safeguarding assets, ensuring operational freedom, and unlocking strategic flexibility. This allows businesses to grow with confidence, protected from censorship, while benefiting from the global, low-cost, and programmable nature of cryptocurrency.




Virtual Analyst & Investor Day Details



As previously announced, PublicSquare will host its virtual analyst and investor day today, Thursday, September 25, 2025, from 11:00 a.m. ET to 1:00 p.m. ET. The analyst and investor day will be broadcast live through a link on the PublicSquare Investor Relations website at investors.publicsquare.com. PublicSquare will post slides and other supporting material to its website on the day of the event.




About IDX



IDX Advisors, LLC, is an SEC-registered investment advisory firm specializing in quantitative, data-driven strategies designed to reduce bias and manage risk. A subsidiary of IDX Global, the firm offers exchange-traded funds, mutual funds, model portfolios, and sub-advisory services, often partnering with other financial advisors through model portfolios and unified managed accounts. IDX's approach emphasizes systematic research, empirical data, and algorithms to deliver risk-focused, dynamically allocated investment solutions.




About PublicSquare



PublicSquare is a financial technology company committed to protecting life, family, and liberty through values-driven innovation. PublicSquare is building an ecosystem of financial solutions that provide consumers and businesses with ‚Äúcancel-proof‚Äù alternatives in today's economy.




Forward Looking Statements

Any statements other than statements of historical fact contained herein are forward-looking statements. Such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, expectations, hopes, beliefs, intentions, plans, prospects, financial results or strategies regarding PublicSquare, anticipated product launches, our products and markets, future financial condition, expected future performance, and market opportunities of PublicSquare. Forward-looking statements generally are identified by the words ‚Äúanticipate,‚Äù ‚Äúbelieve,‚Äù ‚Äúcould,‚Äù ‚Äúexpect,‚Äù ‚Äúestimate,‚Äù ‚Äúfuture,‚Äù ‚Äúintend,‚Äù ‚Äúmay,‚Äù ‚Äúmight,‚Äù ‚Äústrategy,‚Äù ‚Äúopportunity,‚Äù ‚Äúplan,‚Äù ‚Äúproject,‚Äù ‚Äúpossible,‚Äù ‚Äúpotential,‚Äù ‚Äúproject,‚Äù ‚Äúpredict,‚Äù ‚Äúscales,‚Äù ‚Äúrepresentative of,‚Äù ‚Äúvaluation,‚Äù ‚Äúshould,‚Äù ‚Äúwill,‚Äù ‚Äúwould,‚Äù ‚Äúwill be,‚Äù ‚Äúwill continue,‚Äù ‚Äúwill likely result,‚Äù and similar expressions, and in this press release, include statements about our expected revenue, revenue growth, operating expenses, anticipated growth, ability to achieve profitability, and our outlook; however, the absence of these words does not mean that a statement is not forward-looking. Title: Ohio Embraces Digital Frontier: State Approves Crypto Payments for Fees, Paving Way for Wider Government Adoption
Description:
Ohio has taken a decisive leap into the digital economy, formally approving a vendor to process cryptocurrency payments, including Bitcoin, for various state fees and services. This landmark decision, finalized on September 25, 2025, marks a significant re-engagement by the state with digital assets, building on previous efforts and positioning Ohio at the forefront of governmental crypto adoption. The move reflects a broader initiative to modernize public finance, respond to growing demand for digital payment alternatives, and foster an environment conducive to blockchain innovation.

This renewed commitment to integrating cryptocurrencies into state operations is a clear signal of Ohio's progressive stance on emerging financial technologies. By allowing citizens and businesses to pay state obligations with digital currencies, Ohio aims to enhance convenience, streamline transactions, and attract tech-savvy enterprises. The state's approach, which involves a third-party processor immediately converting crypto payments into U.S. dollars, safeguards against market volatility while leveraging the efficiency of digital transactions.

The unanimous approval by the Ohio State Board of Deposit on September 25, 2025, signifies the culmination of months of legislative and administrative efforts. The chosen third-party vendor will now facilitate the acceptance of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin for a range of state fees, ensuring immediate conversion to U.S. dollars before funds are deposited into state accounts. This strategy shields the state from direct exposure to crypto market fluctuations. Ohio Secretary of State Frank LaRose confirmed that his office, responsible for nearly half a million transactions annually, is poised to be among the first agencies to implement this new payment method. Complementing this, the recently advanced Ohio Blockchain Basics Act (HB 116) further solidifies the state's crypto-friendly environment by exempting cryptocurrency transactions under $200 from capital gains taxes, a measure designed to encourage everyday crypto usage.

Ohio's journey into cryptocurrency payments has been a dynamic one. The state first made headlines in 2018 under then-Treasurer Josh Mandel, becoming the first U.S. state to accept Bitcoin for business taxes via OhioCrypto.com, with BitPay as the processor. However, this initial program was suspended in 2019 due to legal and procedural concerns. The current initiative, championed by Secretary LaRose and Treasurer Robert Sprague, began gaining traction in April 2025 with a formal request to the State Board of Deposit to re-authorize cryptocurrency payments, citing updated legal guidance. This proposal received unanimous approval in May 2025, paving the way for the vendor selection finalized this September. The Ohio House of Representatives further bolstered these efforts by passing the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act (HB 116) in June 2025, signaling strong legislative support for broader digital asset integration.

Key players instrumental in this development include the Ohio State Board of Deposit, which granted the final approval; Frank LaRose, Ohio Secretary of State, a vocal proponent of the initiative; Robert Sprague, Ohio Treasurer of State, who supported the modernization of state financial practices; and Representative Steve Demetriou, the primary sponsor of the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act. Industry leaders like Coinbase (NASDAQ: COIN) Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal and Satoshi Action Fund CEO Dennis Porter have publicly praised Ohio's forward-thinking approach, recognizing its potential to set a national precedent.

Initial reactions from the cryptocurrency industry have been overwhelmingly positive. The approval is widely seen as a validation of digital assets' growing legitimacy and utility. Proponents within Ohio and the broader tech community view it as a strategic move that positions the state as a leader in the digital economy. Ohio now joins a select group of U.S. states, including Colorado, Utah, and Louisiana, that have formally embraced cryptocurrency for government payments, with its progress expected to serve as a significant "test case" for other states considering similar integrations.

Ohio's progressive stance on cryptocurrency payments creates a new landscape of opportunities and challenges for various public and private companies, particularly those in the crypto payment processing, blockchain technology, and financial services sectors. While the specific name of the newly approved vendor has not been publicly disclosed, the broader implications are clear.

Potential Winners:

Crypto Payment Processors: Companies specializing in facilitating cryptocurrency transactions are direct beneficiaries. While the current vendor is unnamed, BitPay, which processed Ohio's initial 2018 Bitcoin tax payments, could regain or strengthen its position in the government sector. Coinbase (NASDAQ: COIN), a major publicly traded cryptocurrency exchange and infrastructure provider, stands to gain significantly. Its Chief Legal Officer, Paul Grewal, has been a vocal supporter, and Coinbase's role as a licensed money transmitter in Ohio positions it well to either be the chosen vendor, a partner, or simply benefit from increased crypto adoption that drives users to its platform. Similarly, Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ), through its Square and Cash App ecosystems, offers crypto buying and selling, and could see indirect benefits as more Ohioans engage with crypto for payments. Increased government acceptance of crypto payment rails will likely lead to higher transaction volumes and greater institutional trust for these and other crypto payment gateway providers.

Blockchain Technology Providers: Companies that provide the underlying blockchain infrastructure, security, and consulting services to payment processors or directly to state governments could see increased demand. This includes firms offering enterprise blockchain solutions, distributed ledger technology (DLT) services, and secure digital identity solutions that complement crypto payment systems. The overall trend towards integrating blockchain technology into public finance opens new avenues for these companies.

Companies with Crypto Exposure and Traditional Payment Networks: Public companies that have already invested in cryptocurrencies or offer crypto-related investment products may see a positive impact as mainstream adoption increases the perceived stability and utility of digital assets. Furthermore, traditional payment networks like Visa (NYSE: V) and Mastercard (NYSE: MA), which have been actively exploring and partnering with blockchain and crypto companies, could integrate crypto payment rails into their existing systems or partner with approved processors. This ensures their continued relevance in an evolving payment landscape.

Potential Losers (or those facing pressure to adapt):

Traditional Payment Processors and Banks: Companies primarily focused on fiat-based payment processing for government fees might experience a marginal decrease in transaction volume if a significant portion shifts to crypto. However, the immediate financial impact is likely minimal given the nascent stage of crypto adoption for state fees. The larger risk for traditional banks and payment processors is failing to innovate and integrate crypto solutions. Many major banks are already exploring blockchain and crypto services, aiming to integrate rather than compete directly. Since Ohio's system converts crypto to USD, funds will still flow into the traditional banking system, mitigating direct losses but increasing the pressure for adaptation.

Companies Resistant to Crypto Innovation: Any public company in the financial services or technology sector that entirely dismisses or is slow to adapt to the growing demand for and regulatory acceptance of cryptocurrency payments could lose market share or relevance in the long run. Ohio's approval signals a broader governmental acceptance, which could accelerate consumer and business adoption of digital assets, leaving laggards behind.

In essence, Ohio's move provides a significant boost to the legitimacy of cryptocurrency as a payment method, potentially leading to new revenue streams and enhanced market positioning for proactive crypto and blockchain companies. Conversely, traditional financial entities will face increased pressure to evolve their offerings to remain competitive.

Ohio's renewed commitment to accepting crypto payments for state fees is far more than an isolated local event; it's a potent indicator of the mainstreaming of digital assets and reflects profound shifts in broader industry trends. As of September 25, 2025, this initiative fits squarely into a national movement towards the institutionalization and regulated utility of cryptocurrencies, promising ripple effects across various sectors and setting important regulatory precedents.

The state's current efforts build upon its pioneering but ultimately suspended 2018 OhioCrypto.com initiative. This time, however, the approach is more robust, underpinned by unanimous approval from the Ohio State Board of Deposit and supported by comprehensive legislation like the "Ohio Blockchain Basics Act." By formally authorizing a vendor to process crypto payments, Ohio joins a growing cohort of U.S. states, including Colorado, Utah, and Louisiana, that are actively integrating digital assets into their financial infrastructure. This collective state-level innovation signals a bottom-up pressure for federal clarity and further legitimate crypto's role in public finance.

This development aligns with several key industry trends. Firstly, there's an undeniable increase in government and institutional adoption of digital assets. Beyond Ohio, states like Arizona, Colorado, and Florida are exploring or implementing crypto for taxes, fees, and even state reserve funds. Approximately 40 states have introduced or are considering crypto-related legislation in the 2025 session, with 47 states exploring "Strategic Bitcoin Reserve" bills. This growing governmental embrace signifies a maturation of the asset class, moving beyond speculative trading to practical utility. Secondly, cryptocurrencies are increasingly recognized as a maturing asset class. Regulatory clarity, such as the SEC's settlement with Ripple and anticipated XRP ETF approvals, is boosting institutional confidence. Stablecoins are gaining traction as mediums of exchange, integrated by major players like Visa (NYSE: V) and PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), underscoring their growing utility for payments and settlements.

The technological advancements in payments are also a crucial backdrop. Innovations in blockchain scalability, AI, and Web3 are enhancing transaction speed, security, and efficiency, making crypto payments a more viable option for large-scale operations like state governments. Furthermore, the evolving regulatory landscape in 2025 is pivotal. The U.S. is witnessing a shift towards clearer, more supportive crypto regulations, exemplified by the "GENIUS Act" signed by President Trump in July 2025, which provides a federal framework for stablecoins. This move away from "regulation by enforcement" to a more defined legal structure is expected to drive greater institutional engagement. While states like Ohio lead, federal efforts to clarify oversight and establish consistent rules (e.g., for the SEC and CFTC) will ultimately shape the national environment. The IRS's introduction of Form 1099-DA in 2025, requiring crypto exchanges to report customer transactions, also highlights the increasing focus on tax enforcement for digital assets.

The ripple effects of Ohio's decision are substantial. It will intensify competition among payment processors, encouraging both traditional and crypto-native providers to innovate for government use cases. It will also serve as a magnet for blockchain and fintech firms, with Ohio's supportive legislation aiming to attract talent and investment. For traditional financial institutions, while not directly losing out (as crypto is converted to fiat), there's increased pressure to offer crypto-related services or partner with crypto firms to remain competitive. The recent rescission of SAB 121 by the SEC, making it easier for banks to provide crypto custody, further encourages this collaboration.

Historically, the adoption of cryptocurrency by a state government mirrors past shifts in payment technologies, from the gradual acceptance of credit cards to electronic funds transfers. Each new technology necessitates addressing concerns about security, reliability, and regulatory frameworks. Ohio's repeated foray into crypto payments, learning from its 2018 experience, demonstrates a persistent willingness among states to explore digital asset utility. This state-level experimentation, alongside the global discussion around Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs), underscores a fundamental evolution in how money and value are exchanged, blurring the lines between private and public monetary systems. Ohio is effectively serving as a crucial laboratory for this ongoing financial transformation.

Ohio's recent approval of a crypto payment processor for state fees sets the stage for a dynamic period of implementation, observation, and potential expansion. The immediate and long-term implications will be closely watched by other states, federal regulators, and the broader financial industry.

In the short term, the focus will be on the seamless rollout of the new payment system. The selected third-party processor will begin integrating its services with various state agencies, with the Secretary of State's office leading the charge. Initial offerings are confirmed to include Bitcoin, with the potential for additional cryptocurrencies to be supported based on demand and technical feasibility. The state will meticulously monitor public and business adoption rates, using this data to refine and expand the program. Crucially, the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act (HB 116) will advance to the Senate for a vote. Its passage would cement a favorable legal framework, clarifying regulations for crypto users and businesses within the state. Ohio's progress will undoubtedly serve as a benchmark for Colorado, Utah, Louisiana, and other states exploring similar initiatives.

Looking to the long term, Ohio's vision extends beyond mere payment acceptance. A successful implementation could pave the way for widespread government adoption of crypto, potentially encompassing a broader range of services and even individual income tax payments. The state aims to cultivate a thriving blockchain ecosystem, attracting businesses and talent to establish Ohio as a "Silicon Heartland" for digital innovation. Discussions around establishing an "Ohio Strategic Crypto Reserve" (HB 18/SB 57) are ongoing, which could see a portion of state funds allocated to digital assets, aligning with trends in nearly 50 other states. This could enhance financial efficiency and transparency for the state, leveraging blockchain's inherent capabilities. Ultimately, Ohio's successful integration could influence federal lawmakers, pushing for clearer and more supportive national regulations for digital assets.

However, this journey will require strategic pivots and adaptations. Scalability and user experience will be paramount as adoption grows, demanding efficient transaction handling and intuitive interfaces. The state must remain agile in response to the constantly evolving federal and state regulatory landscape for crypto. Robust cybersecurity and risk management protocols will be critical, especially if a crypto reserve is established. Expanding supported cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin will likely be necessary to meet diverse user needs. Perhaps most importantly, sustained public education campaigns will be crucial to overcome skepticism and ensure broad understanding and adoption, learning from the lower-than-anticipated uptake of the 2018 program.

Market opportunities are significant. Ohio's crypto-friendly environment could attract a wave of blockchain businesses, fostering job creation and economic growth. Clear regulatory frameworks often boost investor confidence, drawing more capital into Ohio's digital asset market. Conversely, challenges include the inherent volatility of cryptocurrencies (though mitigated by immediate fiat conversion), the potential for conflicting or unclear federal regulations, and the ongoing need for robust technological infrastructure. Adoption barriers, such as unfamiliarity or perceived complexity, could also slow uptake.

Potential scenarios and outcomes range from Ohio becoming a leading crypto hub, with high adoption rates and significant blockchain investment, to a more moderate integration where crypto payments become a viable but niche option. A less favorable outcome could see limited impact due to technical glitches, user hesitancy, or new regulatory hurdles, potentially leading to a re-evaluation of ambitions. The most impactful scenario might involve federal preemption or harmonization of crypto regulations, which would require Ohio to adapt its policies to a new national standard, potentially streamlining some aspects while introducing new constraints. Ohio's commitment in 2025 positions it at a pivotal juncture, with its success offering a blueprint for the future of digital assets in public finance.

Ohio's recent approval of a vendor to process cryptocurrency payments for state fees, effective September 25, 2025, represents a significant and well-considered advancement in the state's digital economic strategy. This move, building upon previous exploratory efforts, firmly establishes Ohio as a leader in governmental crypto adoption, alongside states like Colorado, Utah, and Louisiana. It's a clear signal that digital assets are moving beyond niche speculation into the realm of practical, everyday utility within public finance.

Key Takeaways: The core of this initiative is the modernization of state payment systems, driven by a growing demand for diverse payment options. By leveraging a third-party processor to instantly convert cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin into U.S. dollars, Ohio effectively mitigates volatility risks while offering cutting-edge payment flexibility. This strategy is complemented by robust legislative efforts, including the "Ohio Blockchain Basics Act" (HB 116) and discussions around an "Ohio Strategic Crypto Reserve," which collectively aim to create a comprehensive, crypto-friendly ecosystem within the state. This holistic approach distinguishes Ohio's current endeavor from its earlier, more limited foray into crypto payments.

Assessment of the Market Moving Forward: The market is clearly moving towards greater institutional and governmental acceptance of cryptocurrencies. Ohio's actions align perfectly with broader national trends, where numerous states are exploring or implementing similar digital asset initiatives. The federal regulatory environment, particularly under the current administration, is showing a distinct shift towards clarity and support for cryptocurrencies, exemplified by the "GENIUS Act" for stablecoins. This evolving landscape fosters greater investor confidence and encourages broader market participation. Globally, crypto adoption continues to accelerate, with Bitcoin remaining a dominant force, increasingly accepted by traditional financial institutions and governments alike.

Significance and Lasting Impact: Ohio's proactive stance in 2025 holds profound significance. It not only legitimizes cryptocurrencies as a viable payment method but also sets a crucial precedent for other states and potentially influences federal policy. By demonstrating a successful model for integrating digital assets into government services, Ohio contributes to the normalization of crypto and accelerates its mainstream adoption. The lasting impact will likely be seen in a more efficient, transparent, and accessible financial system for citizens and businesses interacting with state governments. Furthermore, Ohio's efforts to cultivate a thriving blockchain ecosystem aim to attract innovation, talent, and investment, positioning the state as a vital hub in the emerging digital economy.

What Investors Should Watch For: In the coming months, investors should closely monitor several key indicators. Firstly, observe the actual implementation and usage rates of crypto payments for state fees in Ohio. High adoption would validate the initiative's practical utility. Secondly, track the progress of Ohio's supportive legislation, particularly the "Ohio Blockchain Basics Act" in the Senate and any further developments regarding the "Ohio Strategic Crypto Reserve." These legislative outcomes will shape the long-term regulatory environment. Thirdly, keep an eye on other states' follow-through on their crypto initiatives, as broader governmental adoption across the U.S. could create significant market opportunities. Fourthly, watch for further federal regulatory harmonization, especially from the SEC and CFTC, as clearer national guidelines will reduce uncertainty and boost institutional engagement. Finally, monitor technological advancements in crypto payment processors and general market sentiment and volatility. While regulatory clarity is a strong tailwind, the inherent fluctuations of crypto markets will continue to influence adoption and investment decisions. The journey ahead for Ohio and the broader crypto market promises to be dynamic and transformative.

Title: Stablecoins are everywhere, but one expert argues that the ultimate winner might not even exist yet
Description:
Leo Schwartz is a senior writer at Fortune covering fintech, crypto, venture capital, and financial regulation.

The hottest technology in crypto right now is the stablecoin, a type of cryptocurrency that is typically pegged to the U.S. dollar. While Tether and Circle's USDC are the clear leaders right now, it's very possible a yet-to-be-released stablecoin could emerge as the long-term winner. That's according to Austin Campbell, a professor and former executive at stablecoin firm Paxos, who shared his thoughts on the latest edition of Fortune's Crypto Playbook (available on Spotify, Apple, and YouTube).

Stablecoins such as Circle's USDC and Tether have long been popular among crypto traders as a form of settlement, but a series of high-profile acquisitions and IPOs‚Äîas well as Congress passing comprehensive legislation this summer to regulate the technology‚Äîhave catapulted them into the mainstream. Now, big tech firms and banks alike are exploring integration, while new challengers are entering the market every week.





According to Campbell, there is fierce competition between entrenched stablecoins like Tether and new entrants like Agora‚Äîwhose appeal lies in the fact that their value doesn't fluctuate like Bitcoin or Ethereum‚Äîbut that doesn't mean a new contender can't take the throne.





On the latest episode of Fortune's Crypto Playbook podcast, Campbell compared the current moment in stablecoins to the 1990s for the internet, when services like AOL and Netscape were just getting started. ‚ÄúThe stablecoin that will probably dominate the future has not been created yet,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt's my prediction.‚Äù 





While many crypto proponents make a similar argument for blockchain technology as a whole, Campbell has more claim to the potential growth for stablecoins. Congress's passage of the Genius Act in July is one catalyst, along with their clear use case over traditional payment rails, with stablecoins touting lower fees and faster transaction speeds. ‚ÄúThe lesson of the internet has been ‚Ä¶ consumers writ large win, and intermediaries just get destroyed.‚Äù 




He pointed to payment firms from Mastercard and Visa to Stripe embracing stablecoins, even though their adoption might upend existing business models. But unlike other corners of the crypto industry, from NFTs to decentralized finance, the presence of established firms might make stablecoins more appealing to companies that would otherwise shy away from the volatile industry. ‚ÄúIt does seem like a chicken-and-egg problem to some degree, where you have to convince people to come on board,‚Äù Campbell said. ‚ÄúBut if you have a major company like Stripe putting so many resources into it, obviously that could create demand.‚Äù





Still, Campbell said, the biggest barrier for the technology is the poor design around user experience, which is why existing players might not have the advantage. ‚ÄúIf I'm betting on horses, it's probably the outsiders laying siege to the current thing,‚Äù he said.

Title: PayPal Taps Spark to Boost PYUSD Liquidity by $1B Through DeFi Lending
Description:
PayPal and decentralized finance platform Spark have teamed up to grow liquidity for PYUSD$0.9996 onchain, aiming to scale deposits from $100 million today to $1 billion in the weeks ahead.

PYUSD, issued by Paxos and pegged to the U.S. dollar, was recently onboarded to SparkLend, Spark's lending marketplace. The integration gives users the ability to supply and borrow PYUSD, with liquidity supported by Spark's $8 billion stablecoin reserve pool. 

This approach contrasts with traditional liquidity programs that rely on expensive market-maker incentives, instead offering predictable depth at set borrowing costs.

‚ÄúPredictable access to deep liquidity is what allows stablecoins like PYUSD to scale quickly,‚Äù said Sam MacPherson, CEO of Phoenix Labs, a Spark contributor. He framed the initiative as a blueprint for how fintech firms can use DeFi to bootstrap adoption of new stablecoins.

The partnership comes as stablecoins see renewed momentum, with global supply climbing nearly $30 billion in three months to $263 billion and daily transaction volumes topping $100 billion. 

Spark previously deployed $630 million in on-chain Bitcoin-backed loans to Coinbase.

‚ÄúWith total DeFi value approaching $150 billion, platforms like Spark are crucial to advancing PYUSD as a cornerstone for defi with deep liquidity,‚Äù said David Weber, Head of PYUSD Ecosystem, PayPal in a press release.

Title: Nine European Banks Join Forces to Issue MiCA-Compliant Euro Stablecoin
Description:
Nine major european banks have joined forces to launch a euro-denominated stablecoin regulated under the trading block's Markets in Crypto Assets regime (MiCA). 

The banking giants involved are: ING, Banca Sella, KBC, Danske Bank, DekaBank, UniCredit, SEB, CaixaBank and Raiffeisen Bank International.

Earlier this year, CoinDesk reported that Dutch bank ING was working on a stablecoin project with some other financial institutions.

The nine bank-backed digital payment instrument, leveraging blockchain technology, aims to become a trusted European payment standard in the digital ecosystem, according to a press release on Thursday.

The initiative will provide a real European alternative to the US-dominated stablecoin market, contributing to Europe's strategic autonomy in payments, the banks said.

The stablecoin will provide near-instant, low-cost transactions and enable 24/7 access to efficient cross-border payments, programmable payments, and improvements in supply chain management and digital asset settlements, the banks said in a joint statement.

The MiCA-regulated stablecoin is expected to be first issued in the second half of 2026. 

The stablecoin consortium, with the aforementioned banks as founding members, has formed a new company in the Netherlands, aiming to be licensed and supervised by the Dutch Central Bank as an e-money institution. The consortium is open to additional banks joining. A CEO is expected to be appointed in the near future, subject to regulatory approval.

Individual banks will be able to provide value added services, such as a stablecoin wallet and custody.

"Digital payments are key for new euro-denominated payments and financial market infrastructure. They offer significant efficiency and transparency, thanks to blockchain technology's programmability features and 24/7 instant cross-currency settlement. We believe this development requires an industry-wide approach, and it's imperative that banks adopt the same standards," said Floris Lugt, digital assets lead at ING and joint public representative of the initiative.

Earlier this week, French bank SocGen's Forge subsidiary, which was the first big bank to launch a euro stablecoin under MiCA, announced that its USD-denominated stablecoin USDCV had chosen Bullish Europe as the first venue to list the token.

Title: Bitcoin News: Ether (ETH) Dips Below $4K, BTC, XRP Slide as U.S. Government Shutdown Risks Mount
Description:
ETH$4,005.03 led major cryptocurrencies lower during Thursday's Asian trading hours, as odds of a U.S. government shutdown hit record highs on the decentralized betting platform Polymarket.

The price of Yes-side shares for the betting contract "U.S. government shutdown in 2025?" rose to 77%, the highest since the contract's launch in January. Traders are essentially pricing a 77% probability that the U.S. Office of Personnel Management will announce a shutdown due to a lapse in appropriations by Dec. 31. Meanwhile, the likelihood of a shutdown by Oct. 1 stood at 63%.

According to media reports, the White House is preparing for large-scale job cuts in the event of a shutdown. On Wednesday, the Office of Management and Budget issued a memo asking agencies to prepare plans for staff reductions and furloughs if a spending bill is not passed next week.

The government is reportedly expected to run out of money by the end of September. To prevent the resulting shutdown, Congress must either approve a short-term funding measure, known as a continuing resolution, or pass 12 full-year funding bills. Since lawmakers won't finish the full-year bills before the deadline, a temporary funding stopgap is needed.

More importantly, to reach the 60-vote threshold needed to pass funding bills, support from both parties is usually necessary.

Ether fell over 3% in Asia, almost testing $4,000 for the first time Aug. 8, with BTC$109,751.25 falling over 1% to under $112,000. Other major tokens such as XRP$2.7748, SOL$201.48 and DOGE$0.2316 fell by 2.6% to 3%. Solana's SOL appeared set to break below $200. 

The CoinDesk 20 Index was down 2% at 3,940 points. Meanwhile, futures tied to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, traded flat to positive. 

Although the exact cause of the cautious crypto market sentiment was not clear at the time of writing, growing concerns about a potential government shutdown may have contributed to the risk-averse mood among investors.

Furthermore, overnight comments from San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly reiterated her support for further rate cuts, but declined to provide a timeline, instead stressing data dependence, which may have hurt sentiment.

The Fed cut rates by 25 basis points on Sept. 17 while hinting at two more rate cuts by the year's end. Since then, policymakers, including Chairman Jerome Powell, have signaled a cautious approach to future rate cuts.

Seven Fed officials, including the New York Fed's Williams, are scheduled to speak on Thursday. Meanwhile, traders are awaiting Friday's PCE data, the Fed's preferred measure of inflation.

"If inflation pressures appear contained, markets may interpret this as room for further Fed cuts, providing liquidity tailwinds into Q4. That could be the catalyst for BTC to attempt a long-anticipated breakout," the market insights team at Singapore-based QCP Capital said.

Title: Bitcoin, Ether Struggle With Options Expiry Imminent: Crypto Daybook Americas
Description:
You are viewing Crypto Daybook Americas, your morning briefing on what happened in the crypto markets overnight and what's expected during the coming day. Crypto Daybook Americas will arrive in your inbox at 7 a.m. ET to kickstart your morning with comprehensive insights. If you're not already subscribed, click here. You won't want to start your day without it.

By James Van Straten (All times ET unless indicated otherwise)

It's a new day, but the same story: BTC$109,751.25 is struggling and ETH$4,005.03 is trying to hold the $4,000 range. Crypto bulls can take some comfort in the fact that there is only one week left in September, a historically bearish month, and what's usually the strongest quarter is just around the corner.

Sentiment within the industry remains subdued. The Crypto Fear and Greed Index sits at 45, which is neutral, but leaning slightly closer toward fear than greed. Part of the reason is bitcoin's underperformance compared with traditional assets. In the past three months, bitcoin has added 7%, while the S&P 500 gained 9% and gold 12%.

Looking ahead, $17 billion worth of bitcoin options expire tomorrow, with a max pain price (the level at which option holders would experience the most financial loss) of $110,000. That is slightly below the current spot price of $112,000 and could provide short-term gravitational pull. For now, bitcoin is expected to consolidate between $110,000 and $116,000 until October.

Meanwhile, the most notable action continues to be in artificial intelligence and high-performance computing stocks such as IREN (IREN). Bitcoin treasury companies, however, remain under pressure. KindlyMD (NAKA) is struggling at $1.17, just above its Private Investment in Public Equity (PIPE) pricing, and Metaplanet (3350) fell another 4% in Tokyo. The stock has dropped more than 70% from its all-time high, leaving it trading at a 1.24 multiple to net asset value (mNAV). This decline highlights how mNAVs have compressed across the broader market. Stay alert!

by Francisco Rodrigues

Title: Four reasons Bitcoin is failing to copy all-time highs for gold and stocks
Description:
Bitcoin and altcoins failed to follow gold and stocks to all-time highs this month, partly because of a lack of stablecoin liquidity on cryptocurrency exchanges. 

Key points:

Bitcoin and altcoins are lagging gold and stocks when it comes to new all-time highs.

Research suggests that liquidity patterns are partly to blame as traders withdraw stablecoins.

History shows that traditional risk assets need to ‚Äúcool‚Äù before crypto surges.

Bitcoin (BTC) is dropping as crypto markets fail to copy gold and stocks. Is the bull market over?

New research from onchain analytics platform CryptoQuant shares four key reasons why Bitcoin and altcoins are ‚Äúred‚Äù ‚Äî Fed rate cuts, stablecoin reserves, leveraged traders and historical norms.

Bitcoin has become stuck recently as liquidity games keep bulls away from challenging all-time highs.

At the same time, both gold and US stock markets continue to post repeated all-time highs, leading to concerns that crypto has failed to become a mainstream asset class. 

CryptoQuant contributor XWIN Research Japan has other ideas. Crypto, they argue, is simply repeating historical patterns.

‚ÄúIn the early phase of rate cuts, institutional capital tends to move first into high-liquidity assets like equities and gold,‚Äù they wrote in one of their Quicktake blog posts, referring to interest-rate cuts from the US Federal Reserve. 

XWIN compared the current market setup on Bitcoin and largest altcoin Ether (ETH) to that from a year ago, and found key similarities.

‚ÄúThe pattern mirrors 2024: a front-run rally after the Fed's rate cut, followed by a correction as liquidity failed to fully rotate into crypto. Only after traditional assets cooled did BTC and ETH outperform,‚Äù they added.

As Cointelegraph reported, Bitcoin in particular has long been known to follow gold higher after a delay of several months.

Continuing, XWIN flagged stablecoin reserves as another factor creating a delayed reaction to the risk-asset moonshot.

Related: Bitcoin Bollinger Bands tighter than ever as trader eyes $107K ‚Äòmax pain'

The overall stablecoin supply hit a record $308 billion this month. Still, at the same time, more stablecoins are leaving exchanges than entering, showing a risk-off or profit-taking mentality among traders.

‚ÄúLiquidity is parked off-exchange‚Äîbridged, sidelined, or used in private markets‚Äîrather than actively deployed to buy BTC or ETH,‚Äù they said.

Similar issues impact accumulation, as data from derivatives platforms showed a trader preference for ‚Äúhedging and leverage strategies,‚Äù a classic response to sideways market action.

‚ÄúHistory suggests Bitcoin tends to ‚Äúlag, then leap,‚Äù XWIN concluded.

As Cointelegraph reported, this Friday's $22.6 billion options expiry is significant, potentially impacting prices moving forward. 

This article does not contain investment advice or recommendations. Every investment and trading move involves risk, and readers should conduct their own research when making a decision.
